title: Council Regulation (EEC) No 2211/88 of 19 July 1988 fixing the production target price, the production aid, the intervention price for olive oil for the 1988/89 marketing year
header:
COUNCIL REGULATION (EEC) No 2211/88 of 19 July 1988 fixing the production target price, the production aid, the intervention price for olive oil for the 1988/89 marketing year
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
For the 1988/89 marketing year, the production target price, the production aid and the intervention price of olive oil shall be as follows:
(a)  production target price: 322,56 ECU per 100 kilograms;
(b)  production aid:
- for Spain:27,10 ECU per 100 kilograms,
- for Portugal:21,29 ECU per 100 kilograms,
- for the Community of Ten:70,95 ECU per 100 kilograms;
(c)  production aid for growers whose average production is less than 300 kilograms of olive oil per year:
- for Spain:29,43 ECU per 100 kilograms,
- for Portugal:23,62 ECU per 100 kilograms,
- for the Community of Ten:81,76 ECU per 100 kilograms;
(d)  intervention price:
- for Spain:155,01 ECU per 100 kilograms,
- for Portugal:203,79 ECU per 100 kilograms,
- for the Community of Ten:216,24 ECU per 100 kilograms.
The prices specified in Article 1 shall relate to ordinary virgin olive oil with a free fatty acid content, expressed as oleic acid, of 3,3 grams per 100 grams.

For the 1988/89 marketing year, 2 % of the production aid earmarked for olive oil producers shall be allocated to the financing of specific measures to improve the quality of olive oil in each producer Member State.

For the 1988/89 marketing year, the percentage of the production aid which may be withheld pursuant to Article 20d (1) of Regulation No 136/66/EEC for organizations of olive oil producers or associations thereof recognized under the said  Regulation shall be 1,7 %.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
It shall apply with effect from 1 November 1988.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
